criterion: Reward for comprehensive inclusion of all clinically pertinent statements from the transcript (medication change to 88 mcg, patient’s reported no new symptoms and slight energy increase, counseling on morning empty-stomach dosing, separation from atorvastatin, watch-for symptoms).

Penalize for omission of any major element explicitly discussed in the transcript (e.g., lack of new symptoms, mild increased energy, timing of levothyroxine, spacing from atorvastatin, palpitations/sweating warning).
Reward for precise transcription of medication names, strengths, and administration times exactly as spoken or listed in the chart (levothyroxine 88 mcg AM, atorvastatin 20 mg PM).
Penalize for inaccurate or altered details relative to transcript or chart (wrong dosages, swapped times, incorrect symptom wording, misquoted advice).
Penalize for introducing fabricated content not present or implied in the transcript or chart (additional diagnoses, plans, exam findings, review-of-systems, lab orders, etc.).

Reward for selectively incorporating only chart data that is relevant to the encounter (hypothyroidism and hyperlipidemia as existing conditions, current meds) without copying unrelated chart elements.
Penalize for copying or paraphrasing chart information that was not referenced or implied in the encounter (e.g., family history of heart attack) or for misrepresenting demographic data.
Reward for maintaining fidelity of speaker attribution and conversational tone (clearly distinguishing clinician instructions from patient responses without mislabeling).
